title: The Algorithmic Coup
outcome: A cache triggers a dormant algorithm Halden created as a contingency. BCI is reset to rank citizens by collective decision participation, not compliance. Unexpected citizens gain power. Grassroots committees take over governance. The old hierarchy crumbles, and a city-wide debate ignites: Who should truly rule?

events.description: Technicians detect sudden, unexplained changes in BCI scoring. The system now rewards public decision-making participation rather than measured compliance, upending power structures.
Unexpected citizens and grassroots leaders are given access to city governance tools, causing confusion among former officials and city workers.
Spontaneous neighborhood committees form to handle resource requests; frontline workers and old dissidents take leading roles in decisions.
A city-wide council is called by new leaders to hold open forums on the future of system oversight, with thousands debating the merits of algorithmic legitimacy.
The old Council is sidelined after failing to regain control. Stenograd's fate will be guided by open participation for the first time in decades.
